subject: science
title: 1st Grade Science
description: Basic science concepts including plants, animals, weather, seasons, simple observations, and nature stories

questions.question: What do plants need to grow?
questions.explanation: Plants need water, sunlight, and air to grow healthy and strong!

questions.question: Which animal says 'moo'?
questions.explanation: A cow says 'moo'! Cows live on farms and give us milk.

questions.question: What season comes after winter?
questions.explanation: Spring comes after winter. In spring, flowers bloom and it gets warmer!

questions.question: How many legs does a spider have?
questions.explanation: Spiders have 8 legs. Count them: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8!

questions.question: What do we use to see?
questions.explanation: We use our eyes to see. Eyes help us look at the world around us!

questions.question: When it rains, what do you see in the sky?
questions.explanation: When it rains, we see clouds in the sky. Clouds hold the water that falls as rain!

questions.question: Which animal can fly?
questions.explanation: Birds can fly! They have wings that help them soar through the sky.

questions.question: What part of a plant grows underground?
questions.explanation: Roots grow underground. They help the plant get water and stay in place.

questions.question: What do fish use to breathe underwater?
questions.explanation: Fish use gills to breathe underwater. Gills help them get air from the water.

questions.question: Which is the hottest season?
questions.explanation: Summer is the hottest season. That's when we go swimming and play outside!

questions.question: What do we call baby cats?
questions.explanation: Baby cats are called kittens. They are small and love to play!

questions.question: What makes the sound of thunder?
questions.explanation: Lightning makes thunder! When lightning flashes, it creates the loud thunder sound.

questions.question: Which animal lives in water?
questions.explanation: Fish live in water! They swim in oceans, lakes, and rivers.

questions.question: What color is the sun?
questions.explanation: The sun looks yellow to us! It gives us light and warmth every day.

questions.question: How many wings does a butterfly have?
questions.explanation: A butterfly has 4 wings - 2 on each side. They use their wings to fly from flower to flower!

questions.question: Story: Lily planted a seed in her garden. She watered it every day. After a few weeks, a green plant started to grow. What did the seed need to grow?
questions.explanation: Seeds need water and sunlight to grow into plants, just like Lily gave her seed!

questions.question: What do we call baby dogs?
questions.explanation: Baby dogs are called puppies. They are playful and love to learn tricks!

questions.question: Story: During winter, Tommy noticed that the trees had no leaves. The ground was covered with snow. What season was it?
questions.explanation: It was winter! In winter, trees lose their leaves and it can snow.

questions.question: Which body part do we use to hear?
questions.explanation: We use our ears to hear sounds like music, talking, and birds singing!

questions.question: What do bees make?
questions.explanation: Bees make honey! They collect nectar from flowers and turn it into sweet honey.

questions.question: Story: Emma watched a bird build a nest in the tree. The bird used twigs and leaves. Why do birds build nests?
options: to lay eggs and raise babies
questions.explanation: Birds build nests to lay their eggs and raise their baby birds safely.

questions.question: When do we see the moon?
questions.explanation: We mostly see the moon at night. It shines in the dark sky!

questions.question: What do caterpillars turn into?
questions.explanation: Caterpillars turn into butterflies! This amazing change is called metamorphosis.

questions.question: Story: Alex went to the beach and found a shell. Inside the shell, there used to live a small sea animal. What kind of animal lived in the shell?
questions.explanation: A crab used to live in the shell! Many sea animals like crabs live in shells for protection.

questions.question: What do we use to smell?
questions.explanation: We use our nose to smell things like flowers, food, and cookies baking!

questions.question: Which animal gives us milk?
questions.explanation: Cows give us milk! We drink cow's milk and use it to make cheese and butter.

questions.question: Story: Maria looked outside and saw dark clouds in the sky. Soon it started to rain. What made the rain fall?
questions.explanation: Clouds made the rain fall! Clouds hold water that falls down as rain.

questions.question: What do plants use to make food?
questions.explanation: Plants use their leaves to make food! Leaves catch sunlight to help make food for the plant.

questions.question: How many legs does a cat have?
questions.explanation: A cat has 4 legs. Most mammals like cats, dogs, and cows have 4 legs.

questions.question: Story: Peter went for a walk in the forest. He saw a squirrel collecting nuts from trees. Why do squirrels collect nuts?
questions.explanation: Squirrels collect nuts to save food for winter when it's hard to find food!

questions.question: What happens to water when it gets very cold?
questions.explanation: When water gets very cold, it freezes and turns into ice!

questions.question: Which animal hops and has long ears?
questions.explanation: A rabbit hops and has long ears! Rabbits use their strong back legs to hop around.

questions.question: Story: Anna's mom said they needed to water the flowers because it hadn't rained for many days. What would happen if plants don't get water?
questions.explanation: Without water, plants will wilt and die. Plants need water to stay alive and healthy!

questions.question: What do we call the place where fish live?
questions.explanation: Fish live in water! They can live in oceans, rivers, lakes, and ponds.

questions.question: When do flowers usually bloom?
questions.explanation: Flowers usually bloom in spring when the weather gets warm and sunny!

questions.question: Story: Jack saw a frog jumping near a pond. The frog jumped into the water with a splash. Where do frogs like to live?
questions.explanation: Frogs like to live near water! They need water to keep their skin moist and to lay their eggs.

questions.question: What do we use to taste food?
questions.explanation: We use our tongue to taste food! Our tongue can taste sweet, sour, salty, and bitter.

questions.question: Which bird is known for its beautiful singing?
questions.explanation: Robins are known for their beautiful singing! Many people love to hear robins sing in the morning.

questions.question: Story: During summer, Ben noticed it stayed light outside until very late. In winter, it got dark much earlier. Why does this happen?
options: There are more clouds in winter
The moon is brighter in winter
questions.explanation: Days are longer in summer! The sun stays up longer, giving us more daylight hours.

questions.question: What do seeds need to start growing?
questions.explanation: Seeds need water, warmth, and air to start growing into plants!

questions.question: Which animal builds dams in rivers?
questions.explanation: Beavers build dams in rivers! They use sticks and mud to make their homes.

questions.question: Story: Sophie watched ants marching in a line carrying crumbs back to their home. Where do ants live?
questions.explanation: Ants live underground in hills called ant hills! They work together to build their homes.

questions.question: What makes plants green?
questions.explanation: Chlorophyll makes plants green! It's a special part of leaves that helps plants make food.

questions.question: Which animal changes from a tadpole?
questions.explanation: A frog changes from a tadpole! Tadpoles live in water and grow into adult frogs.

questions.question: Story: During a thunderstorm, Lucas saw a bright flash in the sky, then heard a loud boom. What did he see and hear?
questions.explanation: Lucas saw lightning and heard thunder! Lightning is the bright flash, and thunder is the loud sound.

questions.question: What do bears do in winter?
questions.explanation: Bears hibernate in winter! They sleep for most of the cold winter months.

questions.question: How many senses do we have?
questions.explanation: We have 5 senses: sight, hearing, smell, taste, and touch!

questions.question: Story: Maya found a cocoon hanging from a tree branch. A few weeks later, a beautiful butterfly came out of it. What was inside the cocoon?
options: a caterpillar changing into a butterfly
questions.explanation: A caterpillar was changing into a butterfly inside the cocoon! This is called metamorphosis.

questions.question: What do we call animals that eat only plants?
questions.explanation: Animals that eat only plants are called herbivores! Rabbits and deer are herbivores.

questions.question: Story: David planted two seeds. He put one in a sunny window and watered it. He put the other in a dark closet and didn't water it. Which seed grew better?
options: The one in the sunny window
questions.explanation: The seed in the sunny window grew better! Plants need sunlight and water to grow healthy.
